description: Ms. codex. Title from text 3, leaf 88b. Ms. erroneously foliated beginning on second leaf. Record follows erroneous foliation. Physical description: 16 lines per page; written in nastaʻliq in black on brown glazed, laid Arabic paper. Poems in two columns. Rubrication and catchwords; first and last pages of text 3 framed in red. First leaf is pasted to another sheet of paper. Extensive water damage, but text still legible; a few paper repairs. Origin: 22 Ṣafar 1105 H [23 October 1693], by Nūr Muḥammad khalaf-i Muḥammad Qāyim ʻurifa [bi-] Kanbū Hāshimī (leaf 88b). Incipit (text 3): نخستىن کنم نوک خامه روان * بتوحىد پروردگار جهان
abstract: Collection of treatises, mostly in verse, on medicine.
contents: 1. leaves 1(bis)b-3b: Mujarrabāt-i Abī Z̲arr. Metrical treatise on medicaments attributed to Abū Dharr, a companion of the Prophet Muḥammad.
3. leaves 7b-88b: Ṭibb-i Shihābī / Shihāb al-Dīn ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm al-Nāgawrī. A metrical compendium of medicine, also known as Shifāʼ al-maraz̤.
4. leaf 89a: Dar shinākhtan-i mazzah-i duhn. Short poem on popular medicine.
5. leaves 89b-90b: Fāyidah dar shinākhtan-i amrāz̤ az bawl-i marīz̤. Extract on diagnosing illness using urine.
extent: 92 leaves : paper ; 195 x 105 (155 x 75) mm bound to 198 x 115 mm
subject: Medicine, Arab—Early works to 1800
binding_note: Modern full leather with blind-stamping and tooling.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
